body.p:
Louisville, Ky. Jan 17th/65
Gov Thos E. Bramlette
Your Excellency:

An opportunity is presented to raise a company for one years State service, composed almost entirely of veterans, who cannot go home. They are to be paid off this week. I was among the first to enter the war on the opening of the rebellion, & obtained a Captain's Commission from the War Department_ being unable, owing to Extra bounties, to fill my the quota, my men were turned over to Col Pope's command. Am a graduate of the Ky Mil Institute, & classmate of Maj Gen D W. Lindsey to whom I respectfully refer. As prompt measures must be taken to secure the men. I would solicit an immediate response. No
effort, upon my part, shall be lacking to fulfil my duty; and as a number of these men speak of arming themselves for self-protection, much trouble may be saved "suspected parties" Wit the utmost respect,

Your Obt Servant:
Geo B Baum

To Thos E. Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky
Frankfort.

Louisville Ky
Jany 17" 1865
Baum Geo. B.
To The Gov-
says, if you give him authority, he can raise in a short time, a Co. of 12 months state troops from discharged Veterans now here --
Issue authority
D. W. Lindsey
Insp' & Adj Genl

Authy issd & Blanks sent to G B Baum
Jany 18. 1863-
